m_szDocSumamry: 3-D printing struggles to enter mainstream Angela Johnson Tuesday,  3 Feb 2015 |  2:42  PM ET CNBC.com Patrick T. Fallon | Bloomberg | Getty Images An attendee photographs a Stratasys Ltd. 3D printer during a CES show. Shares of Stratasys plunged more than 33 percent Tuesday after the 3-D printer maker cut its fiscal 2014 guidance for the second time and its 2015 guidance is below estimates. The company is also writing down a $100 million to $110 million goodwill impairment charge for its MakerBot unit, acquired in 2013 for $403 million.
